snippet: The rejection of a peace deal in Colombia and leftist party losses in Brazil are the latest signs that conservatives are on the rise in the region....
abstract: Brazil renounces leftist party in municipal elections and Colombia rejects peace deal with FARC, in latest shift sweeping Latin American countries as they align themselves with right-wing politics, signalling rise of conservationism in region.
lead_paragraph: The rejection of a peace deal in Colombia and leftist party losses in Brazil are the latest signs that conservatives are on the rise in the region.

headline.main: Is Leftist Era Fading in Latin America? Ask Colombia and Brazil
headline.print_headline: Votes in Colombia and Brazil Reflect a Latin America That Is Shifting Right

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
